Datatable:
Faction Pact This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Mavros. Your faction will gain -0.5% System Improvement [industryColored] Cost on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: -15%), increase scales with game speed.
The Automatons can be friends to any, so long we choose it. The Automatons believe this to be a very particular way of anouncing your frienship, but we will accept it, for now. We are the Automatons. Our only wish is for you to leave us alone so we may uphold our mission, or you will have to face consequences. The Automatons believe this truce to be for both of our best interests. The Automatons recognize the intellect that lay latent in you, and accept the truce. The Automatons admit defeat, for this would allow us to continue our mission without interference. The Automatons know that winning is impossible. Let us go back to our homes. The Automatons do not believe this peace to be acceptable for the continuation of our mission. The Automatons are saddened by the end of our privileged relationship. The Automatons believe this alliance to not be for our best interests, and do not want to be involved in such affairs anymore. The Automatons are hurt from your declaration. But we know how to live alone. The Automatons will finish you off, and then we will take care of our mission. The Automatons will not comply with your reign of destruction and ingerence. Expect resistance. The Automatons have decided that we are now at war. Our claims are backed up by the 563 planetary preservation conventions you have violated. The Automatons are ready to welcome you into our lands, but do not expect to come back. The Automatons notice that your recent actions go against our mission, and your ways oppose ours. This means war. Breaking out of our isolation did not prove to be the best course of action, but the Automatons are always ready to defend our purpose. The Automatons have averted their eyes from your doing because of our privileged relationship, but you crossed the line. The Automatons see you for what you are and we are at war. The Automatons are baffled by this turn of events, but that doesn't mean we are not ready. We have greatly benefited from our temporary cooperation after all, and probably more than you. The Automatons expected this turn of events, and are ready for it. You should have helped us against our ennemy instead of backstabbing us. The Automatons believe you to be able to sustain a privileged relationship with us. The Automatons laud your intelligence and accept this treaty for we now see that there is much to gain for both of us. The Automatons take notice of your proposal but are not interested by it. The Automatons prefer the calm of cold war to the noise of peace, and plan to keep it that way for you. The Automatons prefer the calm of cold war to the noise of peace, and plan to keep it that way for you.. The Automatons take notice of your proposal but are not interested by it. The Automatons believe that you have demonstrated all the qualities necessary to form an alliance with us, and that we are ready to make one with you. The Automatons see the wisdom in your proposal. We will accept it and take a great step towards our mission. The Automatons do not believe that you have the necessary qualities to form an alliance with us. We decline. The Automatons do not believe that you have the necessary qualities to form an alliance with us. We decline. The Automaton have witnessed your intelligence many times over now, and believe a greater form of cooperation could only be beneficial for both parties. The Automatons believe this to be the proof needed to demonstrate your intelligence and wisdom. We accept. The Automatons appreciate your act of requesting an alliance, but we do not believe the basic prerequesites to be satisfied. Please come back later. The Automatons appreciate your act of requesting an alliance, but we do not believe the basic prerequesites to be satisfied. Please come back later. The Automatons know that trading helps to forge relations and help avoid what is commonly called a "zero-sum game" on the galactic scene. This is our proposition. The Automatons believe this course of action to be beneficial for both parties in avoiding a "zero-sum game". The Automatons do not see substantial benefits in this trade, and believe the shipping costs might be higher than the value of what is delivered. The Automatons do not see substantial benefits in this trade, and believe the shipping costs might be higher than the value of what is delivered. Now is not the time, we are busy with our mission. The Automatons informs you that you will receive a very strongly worded letter about your mistreatment of planetary soil, local fauna and many more intricate elements that form an eco-system. The Automatons do not believe this interaction to be beneficial for any party involved. The Automatons believe your actions to be efficient and intelligent. The Automatons appreciate the favor that has been shown and returns it. The Automatons believe you to simply be uncivilised. The Automatons warns you that your other messages will be ignored if you continue in this direction. Hey bud, you're in the way. Here's how you get out of it. Got it? The Automatons have taken notice of your demand and will do nothing about it. The Automatons have examined your demand and concluded that preparation for war is the best option. The Automatons find your demand illogical but, using this point as a new logical starting point, are ready for anything. The Automatons offer this trade agreement in order to strengthen both parties, and to help with our mission. The Automatons believe the proposed trade agreement to be benefitial for the realisation of Automatons' goals. The Automatons will not accept this trade agreement between our factions. The Automatons foresee that this trade agreement will lead nowhere as of now. The Automatons know that pooling our intelligence together could create great results. The Automatons recognize the gains of such a treaty and agree. The Automatons do not believe your intelligence to be able to benefit ours. The Automatons do not believe your intelligence to be able to benefit ours. The Automatons were already ready, and will be even more so when the time comes. The Automatons are disgusted by your disregard of treaties. The Automatons return to isolationism for the time being. The Automatons appreciate the trust granted by you. The Automatons will not open our borders. The Automatons will not open our borders. The Automatons will eject you out of our space of you do not comply The Automatons wishes for borders to be opened, so that we may know more about you. The Automatons take notice of your proposal and ignore it. The Automatons are surprised of your existence. The Automatons greet you. May our civilisations leave peacefully and isolated. The Automatons trust your starmaps more than our own, and wish to obtain them. The Automatons are delighted in the heightened level of cooperation between our civilisations. The Automatons have regrets over this choice, but are glad to not be observed anymore. The Automatons feel belittled by such a declaration, and will make sure to improve our trade so you do not want to leave anymore. The Automatons had faith in our pooling of intelligence, and now it is no more. The Automatons readily accepts your truce. The Automatons prefer peace to war in order to accomplish their mission. The Automatons find this course of action to disregard our best interest. The Automatons find this course of action to disregard our best interest. The Automatons believe that showing you our starmaps will only result in conflict inside of our territory. We do not accept. The Automatons believe that showing you our starmaps will only result in conflict inside of our territory. We do not accept. The Automatons are not interested in being surveyed day and night by another. The Automatons are not interested in being surveyed day and night by another.. The Automatons believe you to be a good candidate in order to avoid a "zero-sum game" when trading. The Automatons see the potential in our frienship, however we are still undecided as to whether to commit or not. The Automatons appreciate you. The Automatons see that we share the same friends, and we want to know more about you. The Automatons are amazed at your creations. The Automatons demand tribute in order to fund our mission. The best course of action for you is to not refuse. The Automatons are hurt by you. We will remember it. The Automatons see your cruelty and condemn it. The Automatons want you to move out of our lands. Quickly at that. The Automatons have warned you and you have ignored us, this is the final warning. The Automatons urge you to remove your colonies lest you want to face the consequences. The Automatons see that you have taken a system from us, and will remember the grudge. The Automatons greet a neighbor to this galactic quadrant. The Automatons inform you that your ships staying in our lands simply give us intel on them. You should leave before the situation escalates. The Automatons are out for blood. Yours specifically. The Automatons believe such a seemingly cruel action to be necessary to secure our interests and our mission. The Automatons want to appease the relations etween our factions, and needs your help for that. The Automatons have taken offence at your attempt to deceive us. You will get hit back twofold. The Automatons have yet more resources to use for our mission but no place to us them. However, your lands present a unique expansion opportunity. The Automatons see your will to hard our privileged cooperation and will not stand by idly. The Automatons inform you that vessels are flying in your lands, in peace. The Automatons thank you for the help give in accomplishing our mission. The Automatons see your lands and believes that they will be better in our hands. You are known to pollute the soil and oceans after all. The Automatons see your ships and we hope it is only for sightseeing. The Automatons recognize your will to not harm us, and we commend you for it. The Automatons believe this to be the correct decision for you. The Automatons are appeased by this gift. The Automatons stand corrected, we believed you to be warmongers but it was not the case. The Automatons feel refreshed by this sudden turn of events, you listened to us and we could not be happier. The Automatons will not stand idly while you continue to build up pressure against us. We hope you are prepared to face the consequances of your actions. The Automaton have warned you many times and yet you refused to listen. Furthermore, you keep degrading your lands, and we believe this to be an opportunity to teach you to not do that, and to respect us. The Automatons have been slighted by you and will not come home until we have paid the grudge back twofold. The Automatons believe you to be too close to us, and we will drive you off until we feel like you are far enough for us to accept. The Automatons see your lands are believe that our wishes have been disregarded. Unless you correct your actions, we will soon take offence. The Automatons want you to stay in your lands, or at least far from ours. The Automatons see your few ships, and we raise you our industrial capabilities. The Automatons see that you behave very offensively, but we remind you that losses can easily be replaced. <LocalizationPair Name="%DiplomaticInteractionNeutralNoBribeParagonAutomatons"The Automatons integrity will not be so easily bribed. The Automatons are surprised by such a turn of events, but we believe that we will come out on top. The Automatons have recognized your intelligence and we want to give you the opportunity to recognize ours. The Automatons see your copious trade, and we believe the best course of action is for us to demonstrate ours. The Automatons need specific materials to accomplish our mission, and you also need something to accomplish yours. We have something that you will like, and so do you. The Automatons are delighted by the fact that you are our friend. The Automatons mission has been advanced signifcantly, all thanks to your trading. The pooling of our intelligence with yours has given significant advancements to our works. We hope it lasts for a long time. The Automatons take offence both at your actions and the course of action you have taken recently. The Automatons demand your military leaves our lands lest you face our industrial might. The Automatons thank you for leaving our lands. The Automatons are baffled by your disregard for our wishes. We will remember this slight. The Automatons give you a final warning. You do not want to turn us into ennemies, do you? The Automatons deem your proposal to be fruitless. The Automatons take offence both at your actions and the course of action you have taken recently. The Automatons feel relief over your ships leaving our lands. The Automatons are hurt by your lack of concern for your friends. The Automatons send you their regards for your gift. The Automatons believe this proposal could help tackle on external threats. The Automatons do not feel the need of knowing what you know anymore. Ever curious just how much of the galaxy we've seen? Sign here, and we'll show you. The Automatons industrial might is having trouble compensating for the ships we are losing. Would you mind helping us? The Automatons believe that isolation in times like these will soon be a death sentence. We should wrok together to ensure not only survival, but more than that. The Automatons know that if you help us now, we will repay the favor later. The Automatons witness the other's alliance, and believe it would be the best course of action for both of us to establish one together. The Automatons witness your wisdom in the choice of your ennemies, we believe that a alliance could be a great boon to our mutual war.. The Automatons see your intelligence, wisdom, and we present our own to you. Would you form an alliance with us? The Automaton sees a way to ensure the longevity of our mission, and you are needed. You protect our back and we protect yours. The Automatons industrial might is no more, we need help quickly. The Automatons will come to the help of their ally, so long we have our industrial might backing us up, regardless of the circumstances. The Automatons present this gift to you in order ot help you thrive. The Automatons might harm their mission doing this, but the prospect of you having it makes it worth it. The Automatons are disappointed by your lack of sensibility. The Automatons take offence at your tyrant like ways, using demands to secure resources. The Automatons are ready to forget past grudges in the face of such gifts. The Automatons will not forget your actions, especially if this is what you intend to reconcile with. The Automatons deem this alliance to be fruitless after your actions. The Automatons are always delighted to see help come, even though this one is late. The Automatons demand help to be sent, lest you face the consequances of being alone in a hostile galaxy. The Automatons see that you made them stray from their mission, and will hold accountable. The Automatons will take none of your simple minded brainwashing. The Automatons readily welcome this addition to the ecosystem we forged. The Automatons thanks you for making the transit faster. The Automatons see your tentative to distract us with another war, but it will not work. The Automatons need the lands you hold, lest we get swallowed up whole. The Automatons see that the best course of action is to declare war on you. Now. The Automatons are dissatisfied with your crimes, and we want you to stop immediately. The Automatons have taken great offence at the indiscriminate murder you do. The Automatons are baffled that such an abomination would wake up in the middle of our carefully crafted eco-system. The Automatons are baffled by your stupidity at blowing up valuable habitable space. The Automatons are thankful towards your intelligent use of these singularities. The Automatons feel that, while we do not completely understand what is happenning, are trying to harm us. The Automatons urge you to sign this, lest we take up arms to save our brainwashed population. The Automatons see you have disregarded our last tentative at peace, and will make you pay the price for it. The Automatons are refreshed seeing this change in you. And in our citizens. The Automatons know that this is the best course of action for you to take. The Automatons see your singularity and we are unhappy about it. The Automatons are ready to knock off your blockade, but will let you change that yourself before we act. The Automatons are usually peaceful, but even peaceful machines can get bloodthirsty. The Automatons look forward to the new lands that this space contains. The Automatons are surprised our citizen's drive towards our mission was not enough to finish our outpost first. The Automatons deem your acts of not paying for the mission to be excessively outrageous. The Automatons sees your ships and we kindly ask for you to not use them on us. The Automatons are not looking for a fight, we just look to live peacefully in our lands. The Automatons have taken notice of your massive fleet and wishes for it to move far from our borders. The Automatons will be ready to collect the parts that fall off your ships to reuse them for our mission. The Automatons will obtain your lands whether you like it or not. The Automatons are greatly shocked to see use of a planetary devastation weapon in order to get what you want. The Automatons sees your planet destroyer, and we plan on staying far away from that. The Automatons have taken notice of how the galaxy looks at us now. We are not very appreciated. The Automatons will not take such abuse, we will strike back to teach you a lesson. The Automatons are surprised to see such action from you, but we will not fight it. The Automatons know that we do not have the power to stop you in what you are doing, thus we will accept this for now. The Automatons deem you to be illogical. The Automatons see that the grudges we held now matter less in our relations. The Automatons are walking away from your imposed peace into a more natural land of cold. The Automatons wonder how much exactly you appreciate us. We require a show of good faith. The Automatons have received your gift of good faith. We commend you for it. The Automatons have reevaluated this peace to be of a level less than satisfactory. Don't be surprised if we return to our affairs soon enough. The Automatons knew the moment you forced peace on us that it would not be something that would go well. The truth is even worse than what we thought. The Automatons have taken notice of your proposal but are not interested.
